page.title: 15The New A30 Road
page.content: The new A30 dual-carriageway was built in the 1970's. The people in Cheriton Bishop made a new Dabby Lane because the A30 went right through the old Dabby Lane. It went right through our farmland and spoilt it. It was built because Cheriton Bishop was getting too busy, especially in the summer holiday times. Thousands of cars, lorries and caravans passed through the village on their way to and from Cornwall. The old road was very dangerous for us to cross. The new road passes below my house and in the winter the snow blocks it at Whiddon Down nearby. By Daniel Netherway, age 11
